nodes.bodyText: What if we could use ImmutableSet.of("LineString", "Polygon", "Point")

Can we have lambda based expression like
map(Slices::utf8Slice).orElse(null)
same comment about function name swap
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -407,6 +407,16 @@ Accessors
 
     Returns the great-circle distance between two points on Earth's surface in kilometers.
 
+.. function:: from_geojson(Geometry) -> varchar

nodes.bodyText: I think the names from_geojson and to_geojson should be switched.
since GeoJSON seems like a standard, we can use this standardized casing in all references in our comments/docs.
nit: split arguments on multiple lines for the assertions going too long

Could you please explain why we need to treat the types differently?  The rfc says the following, so it'd also be valid to return null for multi types right?

GeoJSON processors MAY interpret Geometry objects with
empty "coordinates" arrays as null objects.
use errorcode in the assertion
If we end up going ahead with using JTS's structures during conversion, I'd rename ATOMIC_GEOMETRY_TYPES to something that clearly indicates that this is for the JTS Geometry objects.

is there a reason for converting from esri-geometry-api' OgcGeometry -> locationtech's Geometry --> GeoJSON?
Since types in presto seem to serialize the esri-geometry-api form, is it possible to use any SerDe related methods provided by esri-geometry-api directly?
Not sure I understand the question. The entire purpose of these new built-ins is to convert from esri-geometry WKT to/from GeoJSON. There's no functionality in esri-geometry-api that provides this.
should valid --> should be valid
can we add some tests for Envelope type too?
There's no ENVELOPE keyword that you can use in WKT (like you can with POINT, POLYGON, etc.). You can calculate the envelope from a Geometry with functions like ST_ENVELOPE.

Looks like a GeoJSON object can be a Feature Object, FeatureCollection object or a Geometry object. How does GeoJsonReader/Writer behave in the first two cases?
If it fails the conversion, it would be good to add tests documenting that. May be we can rename the method to to_geojson_geometry and from_geogson_geometry to make the behavior more obvious.
On the other hand, if it silently tries to extract the geometry values, then I think we may want to explicitly fail or call this an "extraction" rather than conversion.

can we document more edge cases here? i.e. deserializing single types with empty and non-empty coordinates,
, deserializing with additional fields, envelopes, deserializing with null values for coordinates field
I don't think the reason for failure here is not that the field is invalid, but rather the missing coordinates.  so may be rename "invalidField" ?
Or add a new test with all three fields (two valid + one invalid) and rename the current one.

The rfc mentions the following:

The coordinate reference system for all GeoJSON coordinates is a geographic coordinate reference system, using the World Geodetic System 1984 (WGS 84) [WGS84] datum, with longitude and latitude units of decimal degrees.

@martint is presto's SphericalGeographyType better suited here instead of GeometryType?
btw, the rfc also mentions the following, but we can't rely on external usecases following the same I think.

where all involved parties have a prior arrangement, alternative coordinate reference systems can be used without risk of data being misinterpreted.
Yes, that seems more appropriate
I updated the built-in functions to use SphericalGeographyType instead.

nit: Returns the GeoJSON encoding of the input geometry.
Please also add things that are not supported: e.g. dropping of additional key-values, feature/featureCollection etc.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -407,6 +407,16 @@ Accessors
 
     Returns the great-circle distance between two points on Earth's surface in kilometers.
 
+.. function:: to_geojson_geometry(Geometry) -> varchar
+
+    Returns the GeoJSON encoded defined by the input geometry.

nodes.bodyText: Jts's GeoJsonWriter#write method, for a non-multi typed empty objects returns a malformed JSON {"type":"Point","coordinates":,"crs":{"type":"name","properties":{"name":"EPSG:0"}}} which seems like a bug: locationtech/jts#411 So we may need to take it into account if we don't want to serialize as null.

Had an offline conversation with @martint who suggested just throwing in the case of an empty atomic geometry since the handling is error prone and inconsistent in the library on which we're relying. I'll follow up with them to see if they're open to cleaning this up in which case we can remove this restriction once the library fixes it.
Returns a spherical geography ... now?
ATTRIB --> ATTRIBUTE
... based on input spherical geography now?
I'd Throws a TrinoException ... and remove @param and @throws below.
Thanks for adding these examples!  ❤️
I think we can remove Optional here
we could put this check once the reader has failed - so that we avoid double parsing for all the valid cases. But since the json seems to be small, this is probably fine for now.

nit: unused
nit: unused
nit: assertInvalidGeoJson and assertValidGeoJson?

nit: since GeoJSON is the output here, may be change Invalid GeoJSON to Unsupported input in error message?
